submission:
class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: List[int], verticalCut: List[int]) -> int:
        
        # Sort the cuts arrays
        horizontalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        horizontalCut_num = 1
        verticalCut_num = 1

        i = 0
        j = 0
        m = len(horizontalCut)
        n = len(verticalCut)
        cost = 0
        while i<m and j<n:
            # print(cost,i,j,horizontalCut_num,verticalCut_num)
            if horizontalCut[i]>verticalCut[j]:
                cost+= horizontalCut[i] * horizontalCut_num
                verticalCut_num+=1
                i+=1
            elif horizontalCut[i]<verticalCut[j]:
                cost+= verticalCut[j] * verticalCut_num
                j+=1
                horizontalCut_num+=1
            elif horizontalCut_num<=verticalCut_num:
                cost+= horizontalCut[i] * horizontalCut_num
                verticalCut_num+=1
                i+=1
            else:
                cost+= verticalCut[j] * verticalCut_num
                j+=1
                horizontalCut_num+=1
        while i<m:
            # print(cost,i,j,horizontalCut_num,verticalCut_num)
            cost+= horizontalCut[i] * horizontalCut_num
            verticalCut_num+=1
            i+=1
        while j<n:
            # print(cost,i,j,horizontalCut_num,verticalCut_num)
            cost+= verticalCut[j] * verticalCut_num
            j+=1
            horizontalCut_num+=1
        # print(cost,i,j,horizontalCut_num,verticalCut_num)
        return cost
